titles.title: Dwight David Eisenhower Commemorative Coin Act of 1988
Dwight David Eisenhower Commemorative Coin Act of 1988
A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue one-dollar coins in commemoration of the 100th anniversary of the birth of Dwight David Eisenhower.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 9/14/1988--Introduced. Dwight David Eisenhower Commemorative Coin Act of 1988 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue not more than a specified number of one dollar silver coins in commemoration of the 100th anniversary of the birth of Dwight David Eisenhower. Sets forth certain features of such coins and provides for their design, issuance, and sale. Terminates the minting of the coins after December 31, 1990. Requires the Secretary to deposit in the Treasury all surcharges received from the sale of the coins, to be used to reduce the national debt.
